org.jgrapes.portlets.markdowndisplay

Class MarkdownDisplayPortlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgrapes.core.internal.ComponentVertex
      • org.jgrapes.core.Component
        • org.jgrapes.portal.base.AbstractPortlet
          • org.jgrapes.portal.base.freemarker.FreeMarkerPortlet
            • org.jgrapes.portlets.markdowndisplay.MarkdownDisplayPortlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<org.jgrapes.core.ComponentType>, org.jgrapes.core.Channel, org.jgrapes.core.ComponentType, org.jgrapes.core.Eligible, org.jgrapes.core.Manager

    public class MarkdownDisplayPortlet
extends FreeMarkerPortlet

    A portlet used to display information to the user. Instances may be used as a kind of note, i.e. created and configured by a user himself. A typical use case, however, is to create an instance during startup by a portal policy.

      • doAddPortlet

        public String doAddPortlet(AddPortletRequest event,
                           PortalSession portalSession)
                    throws Exception

        Adds the portlet to the portal. The portlet supports the following options (see AddPortletRequest.properties():

        • PORTLET_ID (String): The portlet id.

        • TITLE (String): The portlet title.

        • PREVIEW_SOURCE (String): The markdown source that is rendered in the portlet preview.

        • VIEW_SOURCE (String): The markdown source that is rendered in the portlet view.

        • DELETABLE (Boolean): Indicates that the portlet may be deleted from the overview page.

        • EDITABLE_BY (Set<Principal>): The principals that may edit the portlet instance.

        Specified by:
        doAddPortlet in class AbstractPortlet
        Parameters:
        event - the event
        portalSession - the channel
        Returns:
        the id of the created portlet
        Throws:
        Exception

      • doDeletePortlet

        protected void doDeletePortlet(DeletePortletRequest event,
                               PortalSession channel,
                               String portletId,
                               Serializable retrievedState)
                        throws Exception
        Description copied from class: AbstractPortlet

        Called by AbstractPortlet.onDeletePortletRequest(org.jgrapes.portal.base.events.DeletePortletRequest, org.jgrapes.portal.base.PortalSession) to complete deleting the portlet. If the portlet component wants to veto the deletion of the portlet, it puts the state information back in the session with AbstractPortlet.putInSession(Session, String, Serializable) and does not fire the DeletePortlet event.

        Specified by:
        doDeletePortlet in class AbstractPortlet
        Parameters:
        event - the event
        channel - the channel
        portletId - the portlet id
        retrievedState - the portlet state
        Throws:
        Exception
